aws::graph::propositions: # Information about a 68-year-old Private Pilot and Aircraft
The pilot was 68 years old.
The pilot held a private pilot's certificate.
The pilot's certificate included single-engine land rating.
The pilot's certificate included glider rating.
The pilot's certificate included instrument airplane rating.
The pilot held a third class medical certificate.
The pilot's medical certificate was issued on January 3, 2011.
The pilot's medical certificate had the limitation of wearing corrective lenses.
The pilot had a total flight time of 917 hours.
The pilot had 346 hours in the accident airplane.
The accident airplane was a single-engine Mooney M20TN.
The Mooney M20TN had serial number 31-0096.
The Mooney M20TN was manufactured in 2008.
The Mooney M20TN was powered by a Lycoming TSIO-550-G1 engine.
The Lycoming TSIO-550-G1 engine had 280 horsepower.
The last annual maintenance inspection was completed on December 2, 2011.
The total time on the airframe at the time of inspection was 410.5 hours.
The total time on the engine at the time of inspection was 410.5 hours.
The total time on the propeller at the time of inspection was 410.5 hours.
The total time at the time of the accident was 594 hours.
The Mooney M20TN was equipped with the Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System.
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System consisted of a primary flight display (PFD).
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System consisted of a multi-function display (MFD).
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System consisted of an audio panel.
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System consisted of an attitude and heading reference system (AHRS).
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System consisted of an air data computer (ADC).
The Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System included sensors and computers to process flight and engine information.
The Garmin G1000 displayed flight and engine information to the pilot.
The Garmin G1000 interfaced to the S-TEC55x autopilot.
The Garmin G1000 repeated the autopilot mode annunciations on the G1000 PFD.
The Mooney M20TN was equipped with the Garmin GFC 700 Automatic Flight Control System (AFCS).
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS was a 2 axis autopilot and flight director system.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of autopilot controls on the MFD.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of servos with autopilot processing logic.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of flight director processing logic in the Garmin integrated avionics (GIAs).
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of a control wheel-mounted elevator trim switch.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of a control wheel-mounted trim interrupt and autopilot disconnect switch.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of a control wheel-mounted control wheel steering (CWS) switch.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of a remote-mounted go-around switch.
The Garmin GFC 700 AFCS consisted of PFD/MFD-mounted altitude preselect, heading, and course knobs.
The Garmin GFC 700 autopilot contained an electric pitch trim system.
The electric pitch trim system is used by the autopilot for automatic pitch trim during autopilot operation.
The electric pitch trim system is used by the pilot for manual electric pitch trim when the autopilot is not engaged.

text:
# The 68-year-old private pilot

The 68-year-old private pilot held a private pilot's certificate with single-engine land, glider, and instrument airplane ratings. He held a third class medical certificate that was issued on January 3, 2011, with the limitation of wearing corrective lenses. He had a total flight time of 917 hours with 346 hours in the accident airplane.

## AIRCRAFT INFORMATION

The airplane was a single-engine Mooney M20TN, serial number 31-0096, manufactured in 2008, and powered by a 280 horsepower Lycoming TSIO-550-G1 engine. The last annual maintenance inspection was completed on December 2, 2011, and the total time on the airframe, engine, and propeller at the time of inspection was 410.5 hours. The total time at the time of the accident was 594 hours.

The airplane was equipped with the Garmin G1000 Integrated Avionics System which consisted of a primary flight display (PFD), a multi-function display (MFD), an audio panel, and attitude and heading reference system (AHRS), an air data computer (ADC), and the sensors and computers to process flight and engine information for display to the pilot. The G1000 also interfaced to the S-TEC55x autopilot and repeated the autopilot mode annunciations on the G1000 PFD.

The airplane was also equipped with the Garmin GFC 700 Automatic Flight Control System (AFCS) which was a 2 axis autopilot and flight director system. The system consisted of autopilot controls on the MFD, servos with autopilot processing logic, flight director processing logic in the Garmin integrated avionics (GIAs), a control wheel-mounted elevator trim switch, a control wheel-mounted trim interrupt and autopilot disconnect (A/P DISC/TRIM INTER) switch, a control wheel-mounted control wheel steering (CWS) switch, a remote-mounted go-around switch, and PFD/MFD-mounted altitude preselect, heading, and course knobs.

The GFC 700 autopilot contained an electric pitch trim system which is used by the autopilot for automatic pitch trim during autopilot operation and by the pilot for manual electric pitch trim when the autopilot is not engaged.
